qas.question: When did the modern usage of prime minister come into being?
Who was referenced as prime minister in a negative manner when the term was first used in its modern sense?

plausible_answers.text: The term prime minister in the sense that we know it

qas.question: What came into use in the 1800's?
Who was the first person to be called Prime Minister?
What title is no longer honorific?
What term was used negatively in the 1800's?

context: <b2_0>The term <b4_0><b5_0>prime minister<b5_0/><b4_0/> in the sense that we know it<b2_0/> originated in the <a0_0>18th century<a0_0/> in the United Kingdom when members of parliament disparagingly used the title in reference to <a1_0><b3_0>Sir Robert Walpole<b3_0/><a1_0/>. Over time, the title became honorific and remains so in the 21st century.
